scenes

Class GameScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Scene
      • scenes.GameScreen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.event.EventTarget
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AboutScreen, LevelOneScreen, LevelSelectScreen, LevelThreeScreen, LevelTwoScreen, MenuScreen, SplashScreen

    public abstract class GameScreen
extends javafx.scene.Scene
    This abstract class serves as a superclass for all scenes within the program. These scenes require implementation of essential behavior, such as ticking, transitions, and changing scenes.
    Since:
    1.0, 5/16/2022

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      GameHandler controller
      GameHandler instance to control scene changing.

    • Field Detail

      • controller

        public GameHandler controller
        GameHandler instance to control scene changing.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameScreen

        public GameScreen(javafx.scene.Parent root,
                  double width,
                  double height,
                  GameHandler controller)
        Creates an instance of this class.
        Parameters:
        root - JavaFX node root. Known as components in this project.
        width - Width of the window. Should conform to the constants in Constants
        height - Height of the window. Should conform to the constants in Constants
        controller - GameHandler instance.

    • Method Detail

      • onTick

        public abstract void onTick(long currentTick)
        What happens on each tick. AnimationTimer in GameHandler will repeatedly call this method of the currently displayed scene.
        Parameters:
        currentTick - The current tick count.

      • nextScene

        public abstract void nextScene()
        Moves on to the next scene/screen.
